extendedIngredients.name: cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup pepperjack & cheddar cheeses, shredded (one or both!)

extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 jalape単o peppers, cut in half lengthwise and seeded

recipes.title: jalape単o popper grilled cheese
recipes.instructions: Place the peppers on a foil-lined baking sheet with the cut side facing down.  Place the baking sheet on the top shelf in the oven and broil until the outer layer of the skin has blackened, about 8-10 minutes.Place the peppers in a ziploc bag, seal and let them cool until you can handle them, about 10 minutes.  Remove the skins from the peppers. The skins should easily "pinch" off.Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1/2 tablespoon of butter.  Place these slices, butter-side down, on a cutting board.  Spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese on the non-butter-side of each slice of bread.Sprinkle the tablespoon of crushed tortilla chips on one slice, and layer the jalape単o peppers on top of that, covering the whole bread slice.Preheat a skillet large enough for the sandwich to medium heat.  When hot, place the piled on slice of bread, butter-side down, into the skillet.  Pile on the shredded cheese, and place the second slice of bread, butter-side up, on top of that.Grill for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is all melted.

steps.step: Place the peppers on a foil-lined baking sheet with the cut side facing down.
Place the baking sheet on the top shelf in the oven and broil until the outer layer of the skin has blackened, about 8-10 minutes.
Place the peppers in a ziploc bag, seal and let them cool until you can handle them, about 10 minutes.
Remove the skins from the peppers. The skins should easily "pinch" off.
Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1/2 tablespoon of butter.
Place these slices, butter-side down, on a cutting board.

Spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese on the non-butter-side of each slice of bread.Sprinkle the tablespoon of crushed tortilla chips on one slice, and layer the jalape単o peppers on top of that, covering the whole bread slice.Preheat a skillet large enough for the sandwich to medium heat.  When hot, place the piled on slice of bread, butter-side down, into the skillet.  Pile on the shredded cheese, and place the second slice of bread, butter-side up, on top of that.Grill for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is all melted.
